Suppose the polynomial
$$f(x) = a_nx^n + a_{n-1}x^{n-1} + \cdots + a_2x^2 + a_1x + a_0$$has integer coefficients, and its roots are distinct integers.

Given that $a_n=2$ and $a_0=66$, what is the least possible value of $|a_{n-1}|$?

Since $f(x)$ has integer coefficients and its roots are distinct integers, by Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots, $r_1 + r_2 + \cdots + r_n$, is $-\frac{a_{n-1}}{a_n}$ which is an integer.
The product of the roots, $r_1 r_2 \cdots r_n$, is $(-1)^n \frac{a_0}{a_n}$ which is an integer.

Since the roots are distinct integers, the product of the roots is an integer.
Thus, the product of the roots is $33$ or $-33$.
If $n$ is even, the product of the roots is 33.
If $n$ is odd, the product of the roots is -33.
The sum of the roots is $-\frac{a_{n-1}}{2}$.
We want the least possible value of $|a_{n-1}|$.

The possible values for the sum are 1+3+11=15, 1+3+(-11)=-7, ...
If $n=2$, the roots are 1, 33, $-1, -33$, $3, 11$, ...
The set of roots (1, 3, 11) has the sum 15.
$a_{n-1} = -2 \cdot 15 = -30$.
The set of roots (-1, -3, -11) has the sum -15.
$a_{n-1} = -2 \cdot (-15) = 30$.
If the roots are 1, 3, 11, then $f(x) = (x-1)(x-3)(x-11)$.
We need to choose the integer roots such that their product is 33 or -33.
Consider the case where the product of roots is 33. Then $n$ is odd.
The smallest sum is 1+3+11=15.
$a_{n-1} = -2(15) = -30$.
In this case, the absolute value of $a_{n-1}$ is 30.
